workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 1.5 - Watopia Volcano Circuit
workout_file.description: A race simulation on Watopia Volcano Circuit where you'll tackle 5 laps of the course.

textevent.message: Welcome to a race simulation workout, today we're tackling Watopia Volcano Circuit.
Before we get to all the fun though, let's get started with a warmup.
Keep your cadence comfortable here.
So far so good? Nice! Let's chat a little bit about the plan for today.
As you know, we're going to be simulating Watopia Volcano circuit today.
Being one of the shortest laps on Zwift, as well as being mainly flat, the speed will be high.
And of note, the most significant 'climb' comes right before the volcano climb.
This is an area that can cause some splitting to occur.
But, this race almost always comes down to a field sprint.
Let's carry on with the warmup.
In 30sec, we'll do 2 high cadence efforts to ensure the legs are awake.
Aim for 110+ RPM here.
GO GO GO!
Great work, bring the cadence down to something comfortable again here.
UP UP UP!
Perfect, let's take a bit to recover before we start the race simulation.
We're starting with a very hard effort to get off the line.
Then, climbing directly up to the right turn before hitting the actual circuit.
Here we go!
Get off the line quickly!
Good! Now stay in the group up this short climb.
Right turn towards the circuit, and we have a bit of a descent. Take a few breaths here.
Next, we'll hit the flats through the tunnel and onto the Volcano Circuit.
All right, left turn onto the circuit, heading clockwise and onto the rolling flats.
Next up, we have a short, but sharp climb up to the finish, get ready for some effort.
Hit it!
Okay, back onto the rolling flats here. Stay in the group and conserve your energy.
Quick descent, use this opportunity to catch your breath a bit.
And back onto the flats again now, lots of hard riding and big surges on this course.
We have another big surge coming up as we wind up towards the finish again.
GO GO GO!
Keep the power up now as we climb up to the finish.
Even more power now as we finish this 1st lap.
Excellent! Through the finish as we wind through here again.
Use these steadier sections to stand up if needed and catch your breath.
Big surge coming up over the small corkscrew!
Stay with it!
Excellent! Those small, but sharp surges will wear on you over time on this course.
The small descent is just ahead, keep going here.
Great job! Breathe here.
Back onto the power section again before we hit the finish climb.
HIT IT HARD!
Excellent! Keep the drilling it here up the finish climb.
And even more power again to finish this 2nd lap.
Nicely done! That's 2 laps down with 3 more to go. Stay in control now.
Another short surge coming up in 30sec, just stay in the wheels here.
Up the corkscrew climb again!
Great work! Now starts the 'recovery' section of this course. Learn to recover under pressure here.
Make sure you're drinking those fluids today too, don't forget!
Nice descent coming up here.
And back onto the power section again! People always feel refreshed after that short descent.
KICK KICK!
Breathe... Keep going here!
Just a little longer to go and we're done with another lap! C'mon!
Way to go! This is the 2nd to last lap here, make it happen!
Breathe, the later laps is when the fatigue starts to really set in.
PUSH YOURSELF!
Nicely done! Let's recover through this section again. Stand up if you need a stretch.
Quick descent, then get ready to stomp on the pedals again for a bit.
Get the power up!
Up to the finish!
It flattens out just a bit before it kicks up again.
GO GO GO!
Excellent work! This is the bell lap here, my friend! Let's finish this strong!
The final time up the corkscrew is just ahead.
And back onto the flats again now.
Use this short descent well, this is the last chance to rest before the finish.
Breathe, relax.
People are very excited now, even more power here!
Stay with the field over the short surge to start the finish.
Stay here now...Wait to start the sprint and work through the field.
Get ready to sprint...
GIVE IT EVERYTHING!
Nicely done! That course wears you down over time, but you handled it well.
We'll spend a few minutes cooling down now, then check off another workout.
See you next time :-)
